meanings.definition: The organization of a society into industrial and professional corporations serving as organs of political representation and exercising control over persons and activities within their jurisdiction.
meanings.sent1: In some countries, corporativisms play a crucial role in government decisions.
meanings.sent2: The concept of corporativisms has been debated among scholars for decades.
meanings.sent3: Imagine a world where corporativisms decide who gets to vote!
meanings.sent4: The influence of corporativisms can be felt in every aspect of society.
meanings.sent5: The power of corporativisms shapes the future of our nation.

meanings.definition: The principles, doctrines, or system of corporative organization or control.
meanings.sent1: Understanding the corporativisms of a company is essential for its success.
meanings.sent2: She studied the corporativisms of different cultures in her sociology class.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to follow the corporativisms of the household, always finding the warmest spot.
meanings.sent4: His speech was filled with the corporativisms of unity and collaboration.
meanings.sent5: The book delves into the corporativisms of leadership and management.
